image.altText: Dead marine life at Adelaide's West Beach.

props.synopsis: New research awaiting peer review has provided a few revelations about the make-up of South Australia's algal bloom, with a new predominant species — Karenia cristata — identified by scientists. Here's what we know so far.

title.children: What is the new species detected in SA's algal bloom?

image.altText: Close up photo of a woman on a missing poster

props.synopsis: Major Crime Detectives have started searching a property for the remains of Mount Gambier woman Margaret Bernie, who SA Police believe was murdered almost 40 years ago.

title.children: SA Police begin search at property 37 years after disappearance of woman

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with toys.

props.synopsis: South Australia's childcare regulator has cancelled the registration of just one provider in recent years, while nearly 10,000 reported incidents have resulted in no further action, FOI documents obtained by the ABC have revealed.

title.children: Nearly 10,000 SA childcare incidents reported resulted in 'no action'

image.altText: Smiling man in hat stands among artworks

props.synopsis: Known for his generosity and a spectacular art gallery home filled with colourful works, Peter "Jungle" Phillips is remembered by those who loved him dearly.

title.children: Adelaide artist 'Jungle' Phillips dies aged 69 in his colourful home

image.altText: A man and woman holding a newborn granddaughter

props.synopsis: The consequences of a contaminated biopsy sample, which led to a man being wrongly diagnosed with lung cancer and having part of his lung unnecessarily removed, were "profound", a coroner has found.

title.children: Man's misdiagnosis with cancer after pathology error 'linked with his death', coroner finds

image.altText: A large sign of Wallaroo Mines Primary School on top of a fence with its logo of a mining machine

props.synopsis: South Australia's Department for Education confirms the principal of a regional primary school has been stood down pending an investigation into allegations made by students' parents.

title.children: Principal of regional SA primary school stood down pending investigation

image.altText: A photo of a power point at a wall with three black chords plugged in and the power turned on.

props.synopsis: The federal government wants to introduce a retail offering that gives people in certain states free electricity in the middle of the day, but one expert fears there could be hidden costs.

title.children: Who could benefit most from Labor's proposed Solar Sharer scheme?

image.altText: Vincent Tarzia is dressed in a suit and leaning against a brick wall

props.synopsis: South Australia's Liberal party says it will phase out stamp duty by 2041, if elected in March, but the premier has labelled the promise as "one of the most reckless, dangerous policy announcements" he has ever seen.

title.children: SA Liberals to abolish stamp duty if elected, premier slams 'reckless' policy

image.altText: An orange wave buoy rider in the ocean

props.synopsis: Despite a new "specialist mooring" part that took nearly a year to import and install, the Cape du Couedic wave buoy is offline again.

title.children: BOM wave buoy goes 'adrift' in SA five months after lengthy repairs

image.altText: A close up of colourful Gazania plants on the roadside.

props.synopsis: The colourful flowers of gazanias might attract you to buy them at a nursery but it is worth considering whether you are getting an invasive weed causing havoc to our landscapes.

title.children: Flower likened to 'cancer' for environment still sold at nurseries

image.altText: A large lake surrounded by sprawling grass parklands and trees.

props.synopsis: A volcanic eruption 6,000 years ago created the Valley Lake and the conditions for one of Australia's most popular disc golf courses.

title.children: Ancient volcanic crater to host 200 disc golfers for sport's biggest event

image.altText: Jamie Kah smiles, in jockey outfit as she rides a horse at Flemington Racecourse.

props.synopsis: When eight-year-old Jamie started riding lessons on her little pony named Bessie, she hoped she would one day win the coveted Melbourne Cup.

title.children: Why Jamie Melham's Melbourne Cup win was 'like a fairytale come true'

image.altText: A man stands behind a presenting desk wearing a purple T-shirt with a white boots design.

props.synopsis: Every week ABC Behind the News presenter Jack Evans designs a T-shirt featuring a word from his mob's language and shares it with the show's audience.

title.children: Presenter's creative idea to bring Indigenous language on screen with him

image.altText: A woman outside a court building in handcuffs.

props.synopsis: A court has heard harrowing accounts from emergency services and the siblings of a young girl who died after her mother criminally neglected her. Warning: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised this article contains the first name and image of a person who has died. Readers are also advised this story contains content which may be distressing.

title.children: Mother had 'callous disregard' for dying daughter, court told

image.altText: A giant black smoke plume rising above a suburban skyline, trees and a cargo train

props.synopsis: Louisville Mayor Craig Greenberg has confirmed the death toll has risen to at least 11 and could increase further to 12 or more, with several people still missing.

title.children: UPS plane  death toll rises, authorities say engine fell off before crash

image.altText: Flowers placed on the scene of a house fire.

props.synopsis: Queensland's Premier David Crisafulli says the community of Emerald will be in shock after this morning's fire.

title.children: 'Incredible tragedy' as four die in Queensland house fire

image.altText: A truck crashed into a bridge

props.synopsis: A cherry picker passenger has died after the vehicle crashed into a bridge in the NSW Central West, causing it to collapse.

title.children: Transport worker dead after bridge collapses in cherry picker crash

image.altText: Housing under construction, worker climbing frames, wears shorts, white tee and hat, has tools belt around waist.

props.synopsis: The building industry is reporting a lift in approvals and new home sales, but says planning delays and skilled labour shortages are holding back construction, amid calls to unlock higher density development.

title.children: Planning isn't the only reason Australia isn't adding enough homes, builders say

image.altText: Two people holding out their forearms and applying sunscreen on a sunny beach.

props.synopsis: A review by Australia's pharmaceutical regulator has raised concerns about "endocrine disruptors" in some sunscreens. Is there any reason to be worried?

title.children: Do sunscreen ingredients affect hormones? We asked the experts

image.altText: An older man wearing a red tie, white shirt and a black suit jacket with a serious expression

props.synopsis: The US president says a swathe of bad election results this week are a result of the weeks-long political stalemate that has seen many federal workers go unpaid and crucial government programs unfunded.

title.children: Trump blames record US government shutdown for election drubbings

image.altText: Players celebrate, holding the trophy, confetti falling on them

props.synopsis: Brisbane will take on Hull Kingston Rovers in the World Club Challenge in late February with the NRL premiers confirming the return of the showpiece event.

title.children: World Club Challenge returns as Broncos confirm trip to England

image.altText: A view of a National Australia Bank logo in Sydney

props.synopsis: NAB shares have dropped after reporting a dip in net profit, as the bank's boss flags housing as Australia's biggest challenge. But the big move of the day came from James Hardie, with its stock plunging 13%.

title.children: As it happened  -- NAB shares down on weaker profit and James Hardie shares plunge

image.altText: Three men dressed in black walk with a woman in a beige dress on green carpet.

props.synopsis: Prince William has joined Kylie Minogue and Shawn Mendes, along with a swag of world leaders and celebrities, for the annual Earthshot Prize awards in Rio de Janeiro.

title.children: Prince William joins world leaders, celebs for green-carpeted Earthshot Prize awards

image.altText: Albanese gestures while sitting next to a child.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese says he is confident Australia's social media age limit will be a success when it begins next month.

title.children: 'The world is watching': PM says he's confident social media ban will work

image.altText: Tatiana Dokhotaru looks at the camera, she was found dead inside her unit in 2023

props.synopsis: Danny Zayat has been found guilty of murdering his ex-partner Tatiana Dokhotaru after a heated argument inside her Liverpool apartment two years ago.

title.children: Man guilty of murdering woman after claiming she 'purposely killed herself’

image.altText: A man with glasses and dark hair standing in front of a wall with graffiti.

props.synopsis: Many young men are rejecting the "Herculean cookie-cutter mould" of masculinity, but a new report warns boys who hold rigid views are suffering.

title.children: 'Be whoever you want to be': Young men increasingly reject 'Man Box' rules

image.altText: A bald man in a blue suit, white shirt and blue tie walks along a street with tv cameras surrounding him.

props.synopsis: Victoria's highest court rules that Mokbel is no longer "a serious drug offender" and won't be sent back to prison over a methamphetamine trafficking racket.

title.children: Court spares underworld figure Tony Mokbel extra jail time

image.altText: Microsoft signage on a blue light background.

props.synopsis: Microsoft apologises to customers and says it will refund them, after the consumer watchdog alleged the tech giant misled about 2.7 million Australians over subscription costs so they would remain on more expensive plans.

title.children: Microsoft to refund subscription price hike but ACCC still seeks penalty

image.altText: A shirtless man in gloves cleans up a house destroyed by a typhoon, with widespread destruction around.

props.synopsis: The death toll from Typhoon Kalmaegi in the Philippines has risen as the storm gathers strength and heads towards Vietnam.

title.children: Typhoon Kalmaegi leaves 114 dead and 127 missing in Philippines

image.altText: the us capitol dome lit by the sunset and reflected on a car window

props.synopsis: The ongoing federal government shutdown has surpassed the record for the longest in US history, leaving thousands of workers without pay. Here are some of the key numbers.

title.children: 36 days, $14b and 42 million hungry: Inside a record-breaking US shutdown

image.altText: Jake Weatherald holds his helmet

props.synopsis: Jake Weatherald could become the latest player to represent Australia in the Ashes following a superb 18 months in the Sheffield Shield. But his path to the Test squad has not been conventional.

title.children: Jake Weatherald's route to the Test squad a path less trodden

image.altText: Australian men's Test cricket captain Pat Cummins looks at the camera as he wears his baggy green and holds a ball.

props.synopsis: Pat Cummins says his return to bowling has gone better than expected, with Australia's captain still eyeing off a return for the second Ashes Test.

title.children: Pat Cummins feeling good for Gabba Test, but rest may be needed

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios hits a shot

props.synopsis: A revitalised Nick Kyrgios has revealed his shock plans to make a summer comeback and hopefully play the Australian Open in January.

title.children: Kyrgios targets Australian Open after 'miracle' knee recovery
